name: Mexican Pizza
description: If you can't decide between Mexican food and pizza, you should try this Mexican pizza! It's vegan, super easy to make, ands so comforting. Perfect for the whole family!

recipeInstructions.text: Make your pizza dough. You could use my recipe for a vegan pizza dough. Or use a store-bought one. Preheat the oven to 350 °F.
recipeInstructions.name: Make your pizza dough. You could use my recipe for a vegan pizza dough. Or use a store-bought one. Preheat the oven to 350 °F.

recipeInstructions.text: Roll out your pizza dough and place it on a baking tray lined with parchment paper. In a small bowl, combine the pizza sauce with the spices. Spoon the pizza sauce on top and evenly spread it out.
recipeInstructions.name: Roll out your pizza dough and place it on a baking tray lined with parchment paper. In a small bowl, combine the pizza sauce with the spices. Spoon the pizza sauce on top and evenly spread it out.

recipeInstructions.text: Now add the toppings. Start by adding the veggie ground meat, then the corn, the bell peppers, the red onion, and the kidney beans.
recipeInstructions.name: Now add the toppings. Start by adding the veggie ground meat, then the corn, the bell peppers, the red onion, and the kidney beans.

recipeInstructions.text: Top the pizza with vegan cheese.
recipeInstructions.name: Top the pizza with vegan cheese.

recipeInstructions.text: Bake the pizza for 7-10 minutes at 350 °F. Keep the pizza in the middle of the oven, so the crust won't burn.
recipeInstructions.name: Bake the pizza for 7-10 minutes at 350 °F. Keep the pizza in the middle of the oven, so the crust won't burn.

recipeInstructions.text: Top the pizza with vegan sour cream and sprinkle it with red pepper flakes, sliced green chili, and fresh cilantro. Serve immediately.
